Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial peptides and methods of use thereof.
Patent Information.Abstract: A class of cationic, polyphemusin-like peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Examples of such peptides include FRWCFRVCYKGRCRYKCR (SEQ ID NO: 3), RRWCFRVCYKGFCRYKCR (SEQ ID NO: 4), and RRWCFRVCYRGRFCYRKCR (SEQ ID NO: 11). Also provided are methods for inhibiting the growth of microbes such as bacteria, yeast and viruses utilizing the peptides of the invention. The peptides are particularly useful for inhibiting endotoxemia in a subject.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli UB1005 (MIC=0.5 µg/ml), E. coli DC2 (MIC=1 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (defensin-sensitive) (MIC=0.25 µg/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC=1 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa K799 (MIC=2 µg/ml), P. aeruginosa Z61 (MIC=1 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus SAP0017 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=1 µg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=1 µg/ml).Yeasy:Candida albicans (MIC=4 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The solution structure of polyphemusin I is determined using (1)H-NMR spectroscopy. Polyphemusin I is found to be an amphipathic, beta-hairpin connected by a type I' beta-turn.
Sequence Information.Function: PM1 showes high antimicrobial activity against the Gram-negative, Gram-positive and fungal specimens tested.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains two disulfide bonds 4-17; 8-13 and C-terminal amidation.
